line.words: Enandèz ak Poch li pa Tom McWalter

subtitle.line: Hernandez and his Pouch By Tom McWalter
Hernandez and his Pouch By Tom McWalter

line.words: Ektò gwo lyon ble a t ap danse dousman nan forè a.

subtitle.line: Hector the big, blue lion was dancing slowly through the forest.
Hector the big, blue lion was dancing slowly through the forest.

line.words: A inè li rankontre ak Enandèz, kangouwou nwa rapid la. Ektò remake ke Enandèz kache yon bagay byen vit nan poch li.

subtitle.line: At one o’clock he met Hernandez the quick, black kangaroo. Hector noticed Hernandez quickly hide something in his pouch.
At one o’clock he met Hernandez the quick, black kangaroo. Hector noticed Hernandez quickly hide something in his pouch.

line.words: Ektò mande l “Ki lè li ye Enandèz?§ Enandèz reponn nan yon vwa dous “Inè”.

subtitle.line: “What time is it Hernandez?” asked Hector. “One o ‘clock,” replied Hernandez in his smooth, furry voice.
“What time is it Hernandez?” asked Hector. “One o ‘clock,” replied Hernandez in his smooth, furry voice.

line.words: Ektò mande “Ki kote ou rete?” Lyon ble an reponn: “Mwen rete la nan forè a.”

subtitle.line: “Where do you live?” asked Hector. “I live here, in the forest,” replied the blue lion.
“Where do you live?” asked Hector. “I live here, in the forest,” replied the blue lion.

line.words: Kangouwou a mande “Ki laj ou?” “Mwen gen ywitan. Mwen gen yon frè ki gen katran, ak yon sè ki gen dis. §

subtitle.line: §How old are you?” the kangaroo enquired. “I am eight years old. I have a brother who is four years old, and a sister who is ten.”
§How old are you?” the kangaroo enquired. “I am eight years old. I have a brother who is four years old, and a sister who is ten.”

line.words: Ektò te mande “E ou menm§ §M ap viv avèk Penelòp, kòk wouj la, ak Benito tou, koukou zoranj la. N ap viv nan yon twou ki bò rivyè a. §

subtitle.line: “And you?” asked Hector. “I live with Penelope, the red rooster and Benito, the orange cuckoo. We live in a burrow next to the river.”
“And you?” asked Hector. “I live with Penelope, the red rooster and Benito, the orange cuckoo. We live in a burrow next to the river.”

line.words: §Pwason plat, vèt la ak tòti lant ki move a la ap viv nan rivyè a.§

subtitle.line: “In the river live the flat, green fish and the fierce, slow tortoise.”
“In the river live the flat, green fish and the fierce, slow tortoise.”

line.words: Ektò ak Enandèz rete tranki pandan yon ti moman. Ektò t ap panse a sa Enandèz te kache nan pòch li a.

subtitle.line: Hector and Hernandez were quiet for a moment. Hector wondered what Hernandez had hidden in his pouch.
Hector and Hernandez were quiet for a moment. Hector wondered what Hernandez had hidden in his pouch.

line.words: Kangouwou a mande gwo lyon an §Èske w ta renmen vin manje lakay mwen?§

subtitle.line: “Would you like to come for tea?” The kangaroo asked the big lion.
“Would you like to come for tea?” The kangaroo asked the big lion.

line.words: §Wi. Anpil. Mèsi.§ Ektò reponn §a ki lè m dwe vini?“ Enandèz di: §Katrè.§

subtitle.line: “Yes. Very much. Thank you. What time should I come?” replied Hector. “Four o’clock”, said Hernandez.
“Yes. Very much. Thank you. What time should I come?” replied Hector. “Four o’clock”, said Hernandez.

line.words: Enandèz foure men li nan pòch li, pran yon biswit ki te gen adrès li ekri sou li epi li lonje l bay gwo lyon ble a.

subtitle.line: Hernandez reached into his pouch, took out a biscuit with his address written on it and gave it to the big, blue lion.
Hernandez reached into his pouch, took out a biscuit with his address written on it and gave it to the big, blue lion.

line.words: Ektò fè yon ti ne, §Mèsi. Mwen t ap mande tèt mwen kisa ou te kenbe nan pòch ou a.§

subtitle.line: Hector made a small bow, “Thank you. I wondered what you kept in your pouch.”
Hector made a small bow, “Thank you. I wondered what you kept in your pouch.”

line.words: Aprè sa, li te vire l ale an dansan pandan li t ap desann nan forè, epi li rele, §na wè a katrè§.

subtitle.line: Then he turned and danced away down the forest path, calling out, “see you at four o’clock.”
Then he turned and danced away down the forest path, calling out, “see you at four o’clock.”
